chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Larry John Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Inmate Request to the court

11:16 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 and count 5 as repeater and the balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 5 as charged.  Court orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: 

COUNT 1

-12 months county jail, with huber and to commence immediately.  Court grants out of county service and out of county travel.  
-Court grants the defendant 176 days of sentence credit.
-Costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

COUNT 5

-18 months of Initial Confinement and 2 years of Extended Supervision, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 2 years, consecutive to count 1.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-Restitution - $2,000.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Court orders any cash bond on file be applied to the restitution first then the court costs.

Court adjourned at 11:30 a.m


Note:  Checked w/Judge after court in regards to the CIP and SAP programs.  Per Judge - eligible for both.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Court adjourned at 10:09 a.m.
